s.text: Six weeks after stopping the drug, her Hb was 125 g/l and her MCV was 106 fl, suggesting replacement of transfused red blood cells with newly formed red blood cells (which have a higher MCV than older transfused cells).
Our investigations ruled out most of the known causes of acute bone marrow suppression, making the anticonvulsants the most likely cause.

The patient's thyroid function tests were normal.
